Key Match Events: New Zealand won by 9 wickets with 82 balls remaining.
New Zealand chased the target of 283 in 36.2 overs, scoring 283/1.
Pre-Game Insights: England and New Zealand met again in the 2023 World Cup opener, with memories of the 2019 final still fresh.
There were discussions about the potential impact of Ben Stokes' fitness and his hip niggle.
Jos Buttler emphasized that the 'defending champions' tag was irrelevant to him.
Tim Southee was hopeful to be fit in time for the match despite a tender thumb.
New Zealand was banking on their World Cup experience despite being undercooked.
Reece Topley was looking to make up for lost time after getting through warm-ups unscathed.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.
The pitch conditions were a blend of red and black soil, offering both pace and carry as well as slower and lower traits.
The match was played on the same strip prepared for the 2023 IPL final, which was a high-scoring game.
Others: England and New Zealand's World Cup head-to-head record is close, with England winning four and losing five of their ten previous meetings.
Trent Boult needs three more wickets to reach 200 in ODIs.
England had won three consecutive ODIs against New Zealand prior to this match.
